Four things that lead to the continuatio: Mendicants memorize discourses that have been learned correctly, with well-placed words and phrases.
Mendicants are easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish.
Mendicants who are very learned carefully make others recite the discourses.

Senior mendicants are not indulgent or slack, nor are they backsliders; instead, they take the lead in seclusion, rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
